intro: Oxydectes wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Its roots are fibrous and help it anchor in steep, mountainous terrain. Oxydectes wallichii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
